header.title: The Order of the G.'.B.'.G.'. Its Origins and Beginning
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Thelema, Practical Magick

central_thesis: The G.'.B.'.G.'. presents a structured, progressive, and intensely practical curriculum for attaining the Knowledge and Conversation of one's Holy Guardian Angel (HGA) through a series of individual and group magical operations, emphasizing regularity, self-honesty, and direct experiential results over intellectual study.

structure_content.summary: Introduces C.F. Russell as the founder of the G.'.B.'.G.'. and the greatest teacher of Magick in the 20th century, stating the Order's practices are naturally based on Liber Legis, Thelema, and the Aeon of Horus, with Crowley's blessing. Mentions the Order's origins in the Golden Dawn tradition and its closure in 1937, allowing for the revelation of its workings. Highlights the unique, non-commercial nature of the Order with minimal fees and no dues.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER I: The Ultimate Aim of Magick
structure_content.summary: Establishes the ultimate goal of the G.'.B.'.G.'. as the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel (K&C of HGA). Stresses the paramount importance of daily, consistent 'REGULARITY' in practice. Explains the hierarchical instruction system where initiates (I.I.) receive documents from their Immediate Superior (I.S.) or Neighborhood Primate (NP) for immediate digestion and practice, without prior explanation of 'what and how' to avoid intellectual titillation.

Outlines the first two neophyte practices: 1) Daily Dream Recall and recording to cultivate 'Borderland consciousness' (a partial waking state vital for Magickal Imagination and intuition). 2) Maintaining a 'Magickal Identity' record, concentrating nightly on one's desired being to foster self-honesty and discover true Magickal Identity, a precursor to K&C of HGA.

Presents two continuous 'aware attitudes' or oaths: 1) 'I swear to tell myself the truth' – for profound self-honesty, revealing veiled vices. 2) 'I swear to regard every event (or condition) as a particular dealing between myself and the HGA' – to develop constant awareness, interpreting daily occurrences as omens or messages from the HGA, aiding the 'Great Work'. Includes case histories illustrating intuitive messages.

Describes a solitary, intensive ritual performed after at least three months of membership, lasting three days and three nights (or shorter, more frequent versions). The ritual involves memorized words, specific signs and gestures, incense burning, and record-keeping, designed to facilitate an inner relation with the HGA. Initiates also choose a 'Magickal Name' as a guiding word for their unique magickal identity.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER V: The Qabalah of Numbers
structure_content.summary: Explains the Order's practical application of Qabalah, relating Hebrew and English letters to numerical values and Tarot Trump cards. Its primary purpose is to derive numerical values for Magickal Names and other key words, offering insights into their correspondences with Tarot and the Tree of Life, rather than an exhaustive academic study.

Details a regular, weekly group ritual with specific roles (Master of Ceremonies, King/Priest, Queen/Priestess, Acolyte, Four Ritualists) and furnishings. It involves elemental invocations using 'Barbarous Words' (Calypso Moon, Enochian language) and tracing Pentagrams, followed by an invocation of Thoth/Nuit and a shared wine ritual, all performed with strict rhythm and feeling to build magickal force.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER VII: Imprinting the Yi King
structure_content.summary: Introduces a practice involving 'magickal writing' (originally a special alphabet, later substituted by imprinting Yi King trigrams on the body). This develops concentration, imagination, and the ability to view ideas from multiple perspectives, conditioning the individual for the 'Great Work'. It emphasizes comfort over complex postures.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER VIII: The Book of the Law - Thelema
structure_content.summary: Instructs members to engage in intensive mental concentration on one sentence daily from Aleister Crowley's Liber Al vel Legis for at least fifteen minutes. The goal is to understand and express 'Thelema' (True Will/True Individuality) and facilitate K&C of HGA, explicitly warning against intellectual study and encouraging inspired meditation. Provides a commentary on Chapter I of Liber Al.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER IX: Sex Magick - Dianism - The Second Degree
structure_content.summary: Introduces Dianism as the Second Degree of Sex Magick, involving sexual congress without climax. Participants are to regard their partner as a god/goddess (a manifestation of the HGA), suppressing earthly personality, aiming to reach the 'Borderland' state and channel sexual ecstasy to feed aspiration and inspiration for magickal imagination and specific objectives.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER X: Sex Magick - Qodosh - The Third Degree
structure_content.summary: Describes Qodosh, the Third Degree, where climax is essential. Sexual ecstasy becomes 'magickal fire' to invoke desired human qualities (e.g., Love, Wisdom) into the personality, or for practical magical operations (e.g., 'letter method', 'money method', divination, achieving K&C of HGA). It also focuses on the generation of a 'Magickal Child', an autonomous intelligence representing an intensified quality, with strict ethical guidelines against harm.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER XI: Conversation with a God
structure_content.summary: Details the process of selecting a personal 'Totem' (an animal form representing one's nature) and engaging in a 'conversation with a God' (e.g., Proteus). This practice, likened to the 'Invocation of Thoth', aims to elicit wisdom, inspiration, and self-knowledge from within the unconscious mind, ultimately enhancing connection with the HGA.

Guides members in constructing their own individual rituals, utilizing the 'Barbarous Words' (Air, Fire, Water, Earth, Spirit) from the Group Ritual. Emphasizes slow, sonorous intonation and magickal imagination, drawing on the accumulated force of centuries of use, to create internal magickal 'music' and develop an absorbed seeking of inspiration from the HGA.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPTER XIII: The Great Lunar Trances
structure_content.summary: Presents specialized studies: 1) Observing Nature to appreciate design and harmony. 2) Practicing 'trances' or 'willed engrossment' in specific qualities (e.g., Beauty, Joy) for extended periods (days to weeks) to integrate them into one's being and achieve profound experiential states. Also describes a 'Totem trance' for K&C of the HGA, reinforcing the Order's emphasis on practice and results.

key_concepts.definition: An esoteric, Thelemic-influenced magical order founded in 1931 by C.F. Russell, focused on a systematic curriculum for individual and group magical development, ultimately aiming for the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel. It was closed in 1937/1938.

key_concepts.term: Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel (K&C of HGA)
key_concepts.definition: The ultimate aim of Magick within the G.'.B.'.G.'. system, representing the attainment of one's True Spiritual Identity, Daemon, Divine Genius, or Immortal Self. This is achieved through a culmination of progressive magical practices.

Derived from Liber Al vel Legis, Thelema in this context means 'True Will' – the expression of one's True Individuality (Khabs) rather than the active conscious personality (Khu). It implies living in conformity with the Conversation of the HGA.
The ability to make subjective reality objectively real. It is considered over 50% of the total of Magick itself and is enhanced through practices like Dream Recall and Dianism.

A unique, partial state of waking consciousness (e.g., during dreaming or induced by Dianism) that is crucial for Magickal Imagination, intuition, and receiving messages from the unconscious or the HGA.
The most fundamental and valuable lesson emphasized throughout the curriculum, stressing consistent, daily practice of rituals and attitudes as key to achieving magical results and initiation.

Sexual congress performed without climax, where partners regard each other as manifestations of the HGA. Its purpose is to attain the 'Borderland' state, build 'Magickal Imagination', and channel sexual ecstasy as a source of aspiration and inspiration without frustration.

Sexual congress where climax is essential. The sexual ecstasy ('magickal fire') is used to invoke desired human qualities, manifest a 'Magickal Child', or perform practical magical operations (e.g., 'letter method', 'money method', divination). Requires profound concentration on a chosen objective.

An autonomous 'Intelligence' or 'complex' generated through Qodosh (Sex Magick). It embodies an invoked human quality (e.g., Beauty, Wisdom, Clairvoyance) or ability, manifesting as a magnified and specialized aspect of the operator's own subconscious, serving as a conduit for its higher intelligence.

Regarded as the greatest Magick Oracle. Used in G.'.B.'.G.'. rituals for guidance and 'conversation' from the Holy Guardian Angel, with hexagram meanings derived from trigram positions and natures, emphasizing direct interpretation over traditional texts.

States of 'willed engrossment' in specific qualities (e.g., Beauty, Joy) for extended periods (days or weeks), maintained through concentration and imagination. The goal is to deeply integrate these qualities into one's being and transform one's perception of reality.

Unintelligible words (e.g., from Calypso Moon language, Enochian) used in rituals. They are believed to possess magickal force due to centuries of use by magicians and serve as 'magickal music' to stimulate the practitioner's internal state when intoned slowly and sonorously.

Two foundational oaths ('I swear to tell myself the truth' and 'I swear to regard every event as a particular dealing between myself and the HGA') intended as continuous states of awareness, fostering self-honesty and integrating daily life experiences into the Great Work as messages or omens from the HGA.

practical_system.description: The G.'.B.'.G.'. system is a progressive, hierarchical curriculum designed for individual and group magical development, ultimately leading to the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel (HGA). It mandates strict 'regularity' and 'self-honesty' in all practices, viewing daily life as integral to the Great Work. The system progresses from foundational mental disciplines (dream recall, identity work) to solitary and group rituals, integrating qabalistic and oracular tools, and culminating in advanced Sex Magick techniques for invocation and manifestation. The emphasis is on direct, empirical experience and the cultivation of an active 'Magickal Imagination' and 'Borderland Consciousness'.
tools: Specific Signs and Gestures ('Isis in Welcome', 'Enterer', 'Eagle', 'Aspiration', 'Pan Triumphant', 'Opening/Closing the Temple')
Ritual Furnishings (Small table/box, purple cloth, incense burner, charcoal cake, mixed resins of Olibanum, Storax, Lignum Aloes)
Colored Cloths for Quarters (Yellow/East/Air, Red/South/Fire, Blue/West/Water, Green/North/Earth)
Dice (for Yi King oracle in Group Ritual)
Liber Al vel Legis (The Book of the Law)
Sigils or Symbols (for practical Sex Magick operations)
rituals: Dream Recall and Recording (to enhance Borderland Consciousness)
Magickal Identity Journaling (to discover True Magickal Identity)
Magickal Oaths (continuous attitude: 'I swear to tell myself the truth', 'I swear to regard every event as a particular dealing between myself and the HGA')
The Retirement Ritual (solitary, intensive HGA invocation for three days/nights, with record-keeping)
The Group Ritual (weekly elemental invocations using 'Barbarous Words', Nuit, Thoth, and a shared wine ceremony)
Imprinting the Yi King (concentration practice to imprint trigrams on the body for enhanced perception/intuition)
Concentration on The Book of the Law (daily meditation on single sentences of Liber Al to understand Thelema and one's True Will)
Dianism (Second Degree Sex Magick: sexual congress without climax, for Borderland state, inspiration, and aspiration)
Qodosh (Third Degree Sex Magick: sexual congress with climax, using ecstasy to invoke qualities, create 'Magickal Children', or perform practical magick)
Totem Selection and Conversation with a God (for wisdom, self-knowledge, and HGA connection)
The Individual Ritual (personal elemental invocations using 'Barbarous Words')
The Great Lunar Trances (willed engrossment in qualities like Beauty or Joy for extended periods to integrate them into being)

relevant_quotes.text: It is my conviction that the founder of the G.'.B.'.G.'. was the greatest and most efficient teacher of this Century in that field of occultism known as Magick'. (all members of the Order have concurred in this)
The G.'.B.'.G.'. demanded regularity in the work, day in and day out, not missing a single day. Let this be the first and most valuable lesson to anyone—REGULARITY.
We recognise no less than the ultimate aim in Magick. which is to attain to the Knowledge and Conversation of one's Holy Guardian Angel (abbreviated in our literature as K & C of HGA).

The dream state is the Borderland consciousness state. The importance of the ability to function in a quasi borderland state may well be more than half of the technique of Magick. It is involved in making the IMAGINATION to be SUBJECTIVE REAL.
I swear to regard every event (or condition) as a a partl dealing between myself and the H G A.
To lust for result is anathema in Magick

One should have good respect for this thing called 'imagination' the 'Imago' is a manifestation of the force of Spirit- To those having proper respect for the word 'imagination', it can be told that the Magickal Imagination may well be over 50% of the total of Magick itself.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book provides a unique, first-hand account of the complete curriculum of the G.'.B.'.G.'., a Thelemic-influenced magical order that operated in the early 20th century. Its relevance lies in offering a rare glimpse into the practical, operative aspects of a 'closed' magical system, providing concrete instructions and philosophical underpinnings. The emphasis on 'regularity,' 'self-honesty,' and direct experiential results, rather than mere intellectual study, distinguishes it as a manual for serious practitioners. It bridges early 20th-century Western Esotericism (Golden Dawn lineage, Crowley's Thelema) with structured, progressive magical development, including controversial elements like Sex Magick (Dianism and Qodosh). The integration of Qabalah, Tarot, and the Yi King into a cohesive, results-oriented framework makes it a significant document for understanding the evolution of modern operative magick.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is highly specific: serious aspirants and practitioners of Western Esotericism, Occultism, and Magick, particularly those interested in Thelema and systems aimed at achieving the Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel. It is explicitly not for 'casual readers,' 'intellectual gymnasts,' or 'the undisciplined person.' The text is geared towards 'loyal working members' committed to diligent, consistent, and experiential practice, willing to follow directives without immediate intellectual explanation, and open to unconventional and demanding methods.
